departments.services: Provides accommodations and support for students with disabilities to ensure equal access to academic and campus resources. If a student has, or thinks they may have, a disabilty/ies or accessibility need or needs, they are encouraged to contact the accessibility resource center
Offers guidance on course, degree and certificate selection, course planning, assistance to students who may be struggling in classes, and advice on transfer to other institions.
Connects students with essential resources including food, housing, transportation, childcare, winter clothing, and emergency financial assistance.
Central hub for information about student services, facilities, and programs available across campus.
Provides mental health support, individual therapy, crisis intervention.
Assists students with applying for scholarships, grants, loans, and understanding tuition payment options.

Offers health services free of charge to students, including routine preventive medical exams like physical exams, women's annual exams and pap smears, birth control consultation, testing for sexually transmitted infections, acute care for minor injuries and common illnesses, vaccines, laboratory testing, X-ray services, Physical Therapy, and Nutrition counseling, as well as mental health evaluation and referral.
Manages course enrollment, academic records, transcripts, waivers, and graduation processing.
Provides help with campus Wi-Fi, computer labs, software, hardware troubleshooting, Zoom, and D2L digital learning tools.
Supports student-led organizations and activities that promote community, leadership, and personal interests.
